Function Documentation

ideal gBForVanishingIdealDirect (  ) 

A method for running the algorithm for the direct generation of a strong Groebner basis of the ideal of vanishing polynomials in the given ring. This ring is assumed to be a polynomial ring with global ordering over Z/m for some m >= 2.
The command returns the ideal generated by this strong Groebner basis.

Returns:
the ideal generated by a strong GB of the ideal of vanishing polynomials

ideal gBForVanishingIdealRecursive (  ) 

A method for running the algorithm for the recursive generation of a strong Groebner basis of the ideal of vanishing polynomials in the given ring. This ring is assumed to be a polynomial ring with global ordering over Z/m for some m >= 2.
The command returns the ideal generated by this strong Groebner basis which should be the same as the result of gBForVanishingIdealDirect.
With this algorithm, the Groebner basis will be constructed along the prime factorization of m.

Returns:
the ideal generated by a strong GB of the ideal of vanishing polynomials

bool isZeroFunction ( const poly  f  ) 

A method for checking whether a given polynomial f evaluates to zero for all tuples of values. If so, true is returned, false otherwise.
Instead of computing the normal form and checking whether it is zero, this command makes use of an alternative algorithm first proposed by P. Kalla.

Parameters:
f a polynomial
Returns:
true iff f is the zero function

int* nonZeroTuple ( const poly  f  ) 

A method for obtaining a value for each ring variable such that a given polynomial does not evaluate to zero for this tuple.
The tuple is returned as an array of ints with length = number of ring variables.
If there is no such tuple, i.e., if f is the zero function, then all entris of the returned array will be equal to -1.
This algorithm works similar to Kalla's algorithm and may thus be used instead of isZeroFunction.

Parameters:
f a polynomial
Returns:
a tuple a values for which f does not evaluate to zero

poly normalForm ( const poly  f  ) 

A method for obtaining the normal form of a given polynomial f with respect to the strong Groebner basis as computed by gBForVanishingIdealDirect or gBForVanishingIdealRecursive.
Note that this method does not explicitely generate the Groebner basis.

Parameters:
f a polynomial
Returns:
the normal form of p w.r.t. a strong GB of the ideal of vanishing polynomials

poly p_alpha_a ( const int *  alpha,
const int  a 
)

A method for obtaining the polynomial p(alpha, a) defined as follows.
p(alpha, a) = a * (x(1) - 1) * (x(1) - 2) * ... * (x(1) - alpha_1) * ...
... * (x(2) - 1) * (x(2) - 2) * ... * (x(2) - alpha_2) * ...
... * (x(n) - 1) * (x(n) - 2) * ... * (x(n) - alpha_n),
where alpha = (alpha_1, alpha_2, ..., alpha_n), and x(1), x(2), ..., x(n) are the ring variables, i.e., n = number of ring variables.
Each alpha_i is expected to be at least 0. If alpha_i = 0, then the factors corresponding to x(i) are omitted in the above product.

Parameters:
alpha a multi-index of n natural numbers, where n = number of ring variables
a an element of the underlying coefficient ring Z/m
Returns:
the polynomial p(alpha, a)

int smarandache ( const int  m  ) 

A method for computing the value of the Smarandache function for the argument which is assumed to be at least 1. For an integer m, m >= 1, the Smarandache function yields the smallest natural number k such that m divies k!.

Parameters:
m a natural number >= 1
Returns:
the value of the Smarandache function applied to m

void usageVanishingIdealCode (  ) 

A method for printing some information on how to use this code.
